perturbation.original_text: eDiets shall ensure that the eDiets Content complies with Women.com's editorial guidelines. Women.com will provide eDiets with specific editorial guidelines for eDiets Content. Women.com reserves the right to reject any and all content that does not meet Women.com's editorial guidelines. eDiets will then be required to edit such 2 content until all content provided by eDiets complies with Women.com's editorial guidelines and standards. In the event that eDiets fails, within five (5) days after submission by Women.com, to provide Women.com with necessary revisions thereto, such failure shall be deemed to be approval of Women.com's edits.
perturbation.changed_text: eDiets shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that the eDiets Content aligns with Women.com's general editorial preferences. Women.com will provide eDiets with broad editorial suggestions for eDiets Content. Women.com may, at its discretion, reject content it finds unsuitable. eDiets will attempt to revise content based on Women.com's feedback. In the event eDiets does not provide revisions, no automatic approval will be granted.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that eDiets "shall ensure" compliance with Women.com's editorial guidelines, which provides a definitive obligation. The modified version weakens this obligation by stating eDiets will use "reasonable efforts" to align with Women.com's "general editorial preferences". The phrase "reasonable efforts" is ambiguous and subjective, and "general editorial preferences" lacks the definiteness of "editorial guidelines." Additionally, removing the penalty of "deemed to be approval of Women.com's edits" if eDiets fails to revise weakens the obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Ambiguity and Enforceability

perturbation.original_text: Women.com agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to change such policies in its sole discretion from time to time. In no event shall eDiets disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users.
perturbation.changed_text: Women.com expects eDiets to handle consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site with consideration for Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). Women.com reserves the right to modify such policies as it sees fit. eDiets should strive not to disclose or transfer Women.com Data that directly reveals identities, habits, or transactions of Women.com users.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "agrees to treat ... in accordance with" to "expects eDiets to handle ... with consideration for" weakens the obligation. Substituting "should strive not to disclose" for "in no event shall eDiets disclose" significantly reduces the enforceability of the restriction on data disclosure, introducing an ambiguity. The language "directly reveals" also narrows the scope and is ambiguous, which allows room to disclose information that indirectly reveals identities, etc.

perturbation.original_text: All uses by one party of the other party's Marks shall be in accordance with such quality control standards as the licensing party may promulgate from time to time and each party agrees to refrain from all uses of the other party's Marks to which the other party objects. All promotional literature and other materials prepared by a party in connection with its promotional obligations hereunder shall bear appropriate copyright and/or trademark notices as prescribed by the other party, if the other party's content or branding is included therein. Each party agrees that it will not use, register or attempt to register in any jurisdiction, or otherwise appropriate or adopt any name, mark or logo that is confusingly similar to the other party's Marks.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party should endeavor to use the other party's Marks in a manner that generally aligns with quality expectations. Each party should generally avoid uses of the other party's Marks to which the other party expresses concern. Promotional literature and other materials may include copyright and/or trademark notices, at the discretion of the preparing party, if the other party's content or branding is included. Each party will attempt to avoid using names, marks or logos that are arguably similar to the other party's Marks.
perturbation.explanation: The modifications introduce significant ambiguity by replacing definitive obligations with weaker, less enforceable language. Replacing "shall be in accordance with" to "should endeavor to use in a manner that generally aligns with quality expectations" changes a strict requirement into a suggestion. Similarly, changing "agrees to refrain" to "should generally avoid" reduces the commitment. Also changing "shall bear appropriate copyright and/or trademark notices as prescribed by the other party" to "may include copyright and/or trademark notices, at the discretion of the preparing party" makes trademark usage optional rather than obligatory, conflicting with the purpose of trademark law to protect brand identity. Finally, replacing "will not use, register, or attempt to register...any name, mark or logo that is confusingly similar" to "will attempt to avoid using names, marks or logos that are arguably similar" softens the obligation, changing "confusingly similar" into "arguably similar", broadening the interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trademark Law (Lanham Act - US Federal Law)
